page.title: 13St.Ebba's Church
page.content: The name Ebchester is derived from St.Ebba and Castra-a camp or settlement. St. Ebba was the daughter of Thelfred and the sister of the two kings Northumbria-Oswald and Oswy.She founded a convent here in A.D.600 which was destroyed by the Danes. The present church is in the Norman style,restorations were carried out in 1876,1901 and 1904.The Lych Gate was added later. In1866 the church was declared to be a rectory.The present rector is Rev.R.Butt,services are held on Sundays,Wednesdays and Holy Days.
